Comparison of death rates: The expert compared the death rates in Chicago during the COVID-19 outbreak to previous years, specifically looking at the number of deaths in March 2020 compared to March 2019, March 2018, and March 2017. This comparison helps verify the claim that COVID-19 lowered the death rate.
Examination of causes of death: The expert analyzed the causes of death recorded by the Cook County Medical Examiner in Chicago during March 2020. They found that only 11 deaths were attributed to COVID-19, while other causes ranged from gunshot wounds to cardiovascular disease. This examination provides evidence that COVID-19 did not significantly contribute to the overall death rate in Chicago.
Lack of attributing decrease in crime to: 19: The expert noted that while murders in Chicago decreased in March 2020 compared to previous years, officials had not attributed this shift to COVID-19. This suggests that the decrease in crime rate is not directly related to the pandemic, contradicting the claim made in the post.
Expert: s statement: The expert explicitly stated that the claim made in the post, stating that COVID-19 lowered the death rate in Chicago, is not supported by the evidence. This expert opinion adds weight to the verification process and reinforces the conclusion that the claim is not authentic.
